oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Girl (of the Early Race) who killed the Children of the Rain, bringing, thereby, severe punishment upon herself and those who lived with her. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-17. 7473-7519). A girl kills and eats a Water child, tidying up before her mother comes home. This happens a number of times, and eventually the Rain becomes angry and makes a whirlwind gather the hut and the girl into the pond, where she becomes a frog. 1) |han≠kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an) and maternal grandmother (≠kammi), 2) p.7474v: the Water's child resembles a calf, 3) pp.7513v-7514v: see Words and sentences: names of millipedes, 4) See also The occasion on which the story The girl of the Early Race who killed the children of the Rain was related to |han≠kass'o, 5) This story is found in Book VIII-17.
